question: Will SPD win the most seats in the next German election?
description:
German Federal elections to elect the 21st Bundestag are scheduled to tale place February 23, 2025.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the SPD (Social Democratic Party, Sozialdemokratische Partei Deutschlands) wins the most seats in the Bundestag (Germany's lower house) as a result of the next German parliamentary election.

If voting in the next German parliamentary election does not occur by June 30, 2025, this market will resolve to "No".

In the case of a tie between this party and any other for the most seats gained, this market will resolve in favor of the party whose listed abbreviation comes first in alphabetical order.

This market's resolution will be based solely on the number of seats won by this party, not any coalition of which it may be a part.

This market will resolve based on the final total number of seats won by each party, including any overhang mandates (Überhangmandate) and balancing mandates (Ausgleichsmandate), as reflected in the official results.

This market will resolve based on the result of the election as indicated by a consensus of credible reporting. If there is ambiguity, this market will resolve based solely on the official results as reported by the German government, specifically the Federal Returning Officer (Bundeswahlleiter) (https://www.bundeswahlleiterin.de/en/).

question: Mystery Drones searching for nuclear weapons?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the U.S. federal government or its agencies (such as the FBI, DHS, or DoD) confirm that the drone clusters sighted in New Jersey or other parts of the U.S. Northeast are searching for nuclear weapons or nuclear materials by December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the U.S. federal government. However, an overwhelming consensus of credible reporting confirming the drones are searching for nuclear weapons or nuclear materials may also be used.

question: Will Trump comment again on drones in 2024?
description:
Over the last week several large unidentified flying objects have been recorded flying over New Jersey and New York. It has been broadly reported that they are drones: (https://x.com/rawsalerts/status/1867398877067854160)

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald Trump issues a public statement regarding these "mystery drones" between December 16, 2024, 10:00 AM ET and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a public statement includes any social media post (e.g. via Truth Social or X @realDonaldTrump) or public statements (e.g. a comment to the press, a speech given at an event).

The primary resolution source will be the qualifying statement itself, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Drone detection legislation passes in 2024?

question: Will any arrests be made related to Mystery Drones?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if any individual is arrested in connection with the "mystery drone" clusters sighted in the U.S. Northeast by December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No"

Arrest for trespassing will not qualify. Only arrests directly stemming from the operation of drones will count. Arrests relating to incidents outside of Virginia, Maryland, Delaware, Washington, D.C., New Jersey, New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Pennsylvania, and Massachusetts will not qualify.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from relevant law enforcement agencies. However, a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will FDP win the most seats in the next German election?
description:
German Federal elections to elect the 21st Bundestag are scheduled to tale place February 23, 2025.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if The Free Democratic Party (FDP, Freie Demokratische Partei) wins the most seats in the Bundestag (Germany's lower house) as a result of the next German parliamentary election.

If voting in the next German parliamentary election does not occur by June 30, 2025, this market will resolve to "No".

In the case of a tie between this party and any other for the most seats gained, this market will resolve in favor of the party whose listed abbreviation comes first in alphabetical order.

This market's resolution will be based solely on the number of seats won by this party, not any coalition of which it may be a part.

This market will resolve based on the final total number of seats won by each party, including any overhang mandates (Überhangmandate) and balancing mandates (Ausgleichsmandate), as reflected in the official results.

This market will resolve based on the result of the election as indicated by a consensus of credible reporting. If there is ambiguity, this market will resolve based solely on the official results as reported by the German government, specifically the Federal Returning Officer (Bundeswahlleiter) (https://www.bundeswahlleiterin.de/en/).

Note: The CDU and CSU will be considered a single party, NOT a coalition for the purpose of this market.

question: Bernie Sanders votes to confirm RFK Jr?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Bernie Sanders votes to confirm Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) by June 30, 2025, 11:59 PM. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".
